subject: Ethics
title: Therapeutic vs. Reproductive Cloning
description: A quick win: understand Therapeutic vs. Reproductive Cloning.

hook.text: Cloning can grow you a new kidney or grow you a copy of yourself. Same science, wildly different ethics.

buildup.text: Therapeutic cloning creates embryos to harvest stem cells for treating disease. No baby is born.

discovery.text: Reproductive cloning aims to create an entire new organismâ€”a genetic copy of an existing being.

twist.text: Most countries allow therapeutic cloning research but ban reproductive cloning of humans outright.

climax.text: The moral line: creating life to heal versus creating life to duplicate. Intent shapes the ethics.

punchline.text: Same technique, opposite purposes, completely different moral weight.

quiz.question: What is the key difference between therapeutic and reproductive cloning?
options: Therapeutic cloning creates stem cells for treatment; reproductive cloning creates a new organism
Reproductive cloning is widely legal; therapeutic cloning is banned
